model

Class Equal

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Equal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Clause, PCExpression

    public class Equal
extends Object
implements Clause
    This class represents equal clauses. It is a binary operator. It extends Clause.

    Equal clauses are useless as the use of constants or identical variables replaces it. The purpose of this class is to represent negative equalities.

    Author:
    Alexandre Camus

      • getSolver

        public AbstractSolutionNode getSolver(RuleSet rules,
                             SubstitutionSet parentSolution)
        Creates a solver which is a node in the tree proof. This is the version for the equality.

        This function is recursive over all objects that can be proved and creates the tree of proof for a clause.

        Specified by:
        getSolver in interface Clause
        Parameters:
        rules - the RuleSet object containing the rules of knowledge.
        parentSolution - the solution known so far at the parent node.
        Returns:
        the node of the tree of proof.
        See Also:
        Clause.getSolver(RuleSet, SubstitutionSet)

      • replaceVariables

        public Equal replaceVariables(SubstitutionSet s)
        Replaces all the variables in the variable according to the specified bindings. This returns the clause to which the variable has been bound.

        This method is recursive over all PCExpression implementations. This is a terminal case.

        Specified by:
        replaceVariables in interface PCExpression
        Parameters:
        s - the SubstitutionSet that contains the bindings of the variables so far.
        Returns:
        a Equal object representing the bound equality.
        See Also:
        PCExpression.replaceVariables(model.SubstitutionSet)

      • standardizeVariablesApart

        public Equal standardizeVariablesApart(Hashtable<Variable,Variable> newVars)
        Standardizes the variables in order to be sure that there won't be any variable clashes. This returns a copy of the variable but with a different id.

        This method is recursive over all PCExpression implementations. This is a terminal case.

        Specified by:
        standardizeVariablesApart in interface PCExpression
        Parameters:
        newVars - is a parameter to save over the recursion all the variable replacements done so far.
        Returns:
        a Equal object representing the standardized equality.
        See Also:
        PCExpression.standardizeVariablesApart(java.util.Hashtable)

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns the negative clause under the form of: "operand1 == operand2".
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        See Also:
        Object.toString()
